mainEntity.name: How is take-home pay calculated in the UK?

acceptedAnswer.text: Our UK Salary Calculator deducts PAYE income tax, National Insurance contributions, and optional student loan repayments to show your net take-home pay. Calculations follow current HMRC guidelines and include the Personal Allowance.

mainEntity.name: What is the difference between umbrella and Ltd contractors?

acceptedAnswer.text: Ltd contractors operate through their own limited company and pay corporation tax on profits. Umbrella contractors work through an agency and are treated as employees for tax purposes. Our Contractor Salary Calculator helps compare the net income differences.

mainEntity.name: How does National Insurance work in the UK?

acceptedAnswer.text: National Insurance is paid on earnings above ¬£12,570 (2024/25) at rates of 8% for earnings up to ¬£50,270 and 2% above that. It funds state benefits and the NHS. Our UK calculators include all National Insurance calculations.
